data.title: BitMine Acquires 44,036 ETH Amid Market Downturn
data.description: According to Foresight News, Lookonchain monitoring has revealed that BitMine has purchased 44,036 ETH, valued at approximately $166 million, during a period of market decline.

data.title: Australian police have cracked the mnemonic phrase of a $6.4 million cryptocurrency wallet.
data.description: Australian Federal Police have dismantled a cryptocurrency wallet containing $6.4 million, believed to be proceeds of organized crime. This operation is part of a broader crackdown on encrypted communication networks believed to be used by criminal corporations. The Australian Federal Police revealed they deciphered the wallet's mnemonic phrase and seized a total of $6.4 million. Additionally, police arrested 32-year-old Sydney resident Jay Je Yoon Jung, accused of developing Ghost, a highly encrypted communication platform believed by police to be specifically designed for criminal activity. (Cryptopolitan)

data.title: Planet Morning News
data.description: 1. Strategy's Q3 net profit fell to $2.8 billion, with Bitcoin holdings growth slowing; 2. Coinbase Q3 earnings: net profit of $433 million, total revenue of $1.9 billion, and an increase of $299 million in Bitcoin holdings; 3. JPMorgan Chase executed its first fund services transaction on its Kinexys blockchain; 4. Ethereum's next major upgrade, Fusaka, is scheduled to launch on December 3; 5. Canary XRP spot ETF's latest application removed the "delayed revision clause," and is expected to list on November 13; 6. Unichain expanded its non-EVM asset support, introducing DOGE, XRP, and Zcash; 7. Jupiter has launched a vote on whether to burn 130 million buyback tokens; 8. Noble launched its airdrop process, requiring users to link their Cosmos addresses to their Ethereum addresses; 9. SuiNS launched a retrospective governance airdrop, distributing staked NS tokens to users who participated in the proposal vote.

data.title: An unknown hacker who bought high and sold low dumped 2,655 ETH, incurring a loss of $758,000.
data.description: According to on-chain analyst "Ai Yi" (@ai_9684xtpa), an unknown hacker engaged in speculative trading, selling 2,655 ETH (approximately $9.93 million) at an average price of $3,740.78 over the past 10 hours. This portion of ETH was acquired between October 21st and October 23rd at an average price of $4,026.58, resulting in a loss of $758,000 from the sale.

data.title: SuiNS has launched a retrospective governance airdrop, distributing staked NS tokens to users who participated in the proposal vote.
data.description: Sui Name Service (SuiNS) has officially announced a retrospective governance reward airdrop, in which early SuiNS DAO voters will automatically receive staked NS tokens. Specifically, users who voted on any SuiNS DAO proposal using more than 0.1 NS tokens between November 2024 and June 2025 are eligible for the reward. This airdrop requires no application or additional steps; the rewards are already activated on the SuiNS voting platform and can be viewed simply by connecting your wallet.

data.title: U.S. Senate Votes to End Global Tariff Policy Amid Legislative Challenges
data.description:
According to PANews, the U.S. Senate has voted 51-47 in favor of a resolution to terminate U.S. President Donald Trump's comprehensive global tariff policy. The Senate announced the approval of a joint resolution to end the national emergency declared by the President for implementing global tariffs. Earlier this week, the Senate passed two resolutions aimed at removing tariffs imposed on Canada and Brazil.

These resolutions now require approval from the House of Representatives. However, previous attempts to overturn tariff legislation have been blocked by House Republicans, making it unlikely for these resolutions to proceed to a vote. Even if the House passes the resolutions, Congress would need a two-thirds majority to override a presidential veto.

data.title: Gold Lift and Meme Strength Define Altcoin Season Pockets as Traders Track Global Policy Moves
data.description:
Altcoins are finding support in selective areas while the wider market remains cautious. Activity concentrates in tokens tied to measurable drivers such as policy developments, liquidity programs, and on-chain participation. MemeCore, Aerodrome Finance, and Tether Gold all posted gains through October 30, offering a look at how traders are repositioning around utility and global sentiment […]
source: https://cryptonews.com/news/gold-lift-and-meme-strength-define-altcoin-season-pockets-as-traders-track-global-policy-moves/

data.title: Jupiter has launched a vote on whether to burn 130 million repurchase tokens.
data.description: Jupiter has launched a community vote on whether to burn 130 million buyback tokens (approximately 4% of the circulating supply) in the Litterbox Trust contract. The vote will end on November 4.

data.title: The "40x Leveraged BTC Whale" suffered a $6.3 million loss after only one day of trading and has since used its remaining funds to go long on BTC again at a 40x leverage.
data.description: According to on-chain data analyst Yu Jin, a whale address that went long on $107 million worth of BTC yesterday with 40x leverage had its position liquidated during last night's sharp decline. Ultimately, the entire long position, worth $143 million, was liquidated, resulting in a loss of $6.3 million. This whale has now used the remaining $470,000 from last night's liquidation to continue going long on BTC with 40x leverage, bringing its position to $19 million. The liquidation price is only $1200 away from the current price.

data.title: Ethereum's Fusaka Hard Fork Scheduled for December Launch
data.description:
According to BlockBeats, researchers from the Ethereum Foundation have officially set the date for the mainnet hard fork, codenamed 'Fusaka.' During a recent 'All Core Developers' call, it was announced that Fusaka will go live on December 3.

Developers have been targeting this date since at least mid-September. Fusaka was activated on the Hoodi testnet earlier this week, marking the final step towards its mainnet activation. Earlier this month, it was successfully deployed on the Holesky and Sepolia testnets.

The backward-compatible Fusaka hard fork will implement approximately a dozen Ethereum Improvement Proposals aimed at enhancing the sustainability, security, and scalability of the base chain and its surrounding layer-two ecosystem. Notably, Fusaka will introduce 'Peer Data Availability Sampling' (PeerDAS), a technology designed to simplify data access for validators. PeerDAS was initially planned for Ethereum's previous major upgrade in February, known as Pectra, but was delayed for further testing. Additionally, Fusaka will increase Ethereum's block gas limit from 30 million units to 150 million units, which is expected to rapidly double the data block capacity.

data.title: JPMorgan Chase executes its first fund servicing transaction on its Kinexys blockchain.
data.description: JPMorgan Chase is expanding the application of its Kinexys blockchain from payments and repurchase transactions to the back-office operations of the private market. The firm said Thursday that its asset and wealth management division, in partnership with fund manager Citco, completed its first transaction using a new system called Kinexys Fund Flow. This system automates the recording of alternative investment fund activity on a private blockchain. The tool tokenizes investor records and uses smart contracts to automatically transfer cash between JPMorgan brokerage accounts and fund managers, replacing the manual reconciliation and wire transfer methods currently dominant in private fund operations. The system runs on the same permissioned Kinexys network that underpins JPMorgan's tokenized deposit and payment products. Kinexys Fund Flow is expected to be fully rolled out early next year, with more features to be added by 2026. Citco stated that the technology can reduce error rates and costs across the industry, while JPMorgan sees it as part of a broader initiative to modernize alternative asset distribution and services. (The Block)

data.title: To initiate the Noble airdrop process, users need to link their Cosmos address to their Ethereum address.
data.description: Stablecoin protocol Noble officially announced on Twitter that it has launched its airdrop process. From October 30th to December 31st, users must link their Cosmos address to their Ethereum mainnet address and complete this step to be eligible for the subsequent airdrop. On TGE day, users can claim their NOBLE tokens to their Ethereum address and then transfer them to the Noble AppLayer.

data.title: Ethereum's next major upgrade, Fusaka, is scheduled to launch on December 3rd.
data.description: Ethereum Foundation researchers have officially set a date for its next mainnet hard fork (codenamed "Fusaka"). During a core developer call on Thursday, Ethereum Foundation researchers stated that Fusaka will launch on December 3rd. Developers have been aiming for this date since at least mid-September. Fusaka launched on the Hoodi testnet this Tuesday, the final step towards mainnet activation. Earlier this month, it was successfully deployed on the Holesky and Sepolia testnets. This backward-compatible Fusaka hard fork will implement approximately a dozen Ethereum improvement proposals to enhance the sustainability, security, and scalability of the base chain and its surrounding Layer 2 ecosystem. Most notably, Fusaka will implement Peer Data Availability Sampling (PeerDAS), a technology that simplifies validators' access to data. PeerDAS was initially planned for Ethereum's last major upgrade (Pectra in February) but was delayed due to the need for testing. Fusaka will also increase Ethereum's block gas cap from 30 million units to 150 million units, which is expected to rapidly double block capacity. (The Block)
